Title: Tinubu promises better economy, security amid opposition’s knocks
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has declared that 2026 will mark the beginning of a more robust phase of economic growth for Nigeria . The President said 2026 would mark the start of a new phase of growth for the country .

Title: Obi’s ADC defection fractures LP, reshapes opposition ahead of 2027
Summary: Peter Obi’s defection to the African Democratic Congress (ADC) exposes deep fractures within the Labour Party . Divergent reactions have followed the defection .

Title: Tackling the scourge of age falsification among athletes
Summary: The January 16, 2026, deadline handed to Nigeria by the World Athletics Integrity Unit (AIU) to explain the circumstances surrounding the incident .

Title: Senate pushes state police, youth fund, tech-based intel to curb insecurity
Summary: Senate pushes state police, youth fund, tech-based intel to curb insecurity . The Senate has thrown its weight behind the establishment of state police and a National Youth Stabilisation Fund .

Title: ‘Aviation industry still hostile to tourists, records mild growth in 2025’
Summary: Nigeria’s aviation sector remained unfriendly to tourists in 2025 and recorded only marginal growth, despite policy reforms and  policy reforms .

Title: NNPC monthly revenue drops 14% to N4.358trn
Summary: NNPC Ltd. Pays N967bn to Government . Monthly revenue declined by 14.17 per cent in November 2025 to N4.358trn . The monthly revenue was down from N5.078trn recorded in October .

Title: Senator Godiya Akwashiki dies in Indian hospital at 52
Summary: Sen. Godiya Akwashiki (SDP/Nasarawa North) has died at the age of 52, following a protracted illness . The SDP Senator died in Indian hospital after a long illness .

Title: Nigeria’s oil output drops 5.9% to 1.599m bpd
Summary: Nigeria’s oil output fell by 5.9 percent year-on-year (YoY) to 1.599 million barrels per day (bpd), including condensate, in November 2025 from 1.698 million bpd in the corresponding period of 2024 . The Nigerian Upstream Petroleum Regulatory Commission (NUPRC

Title: 2025: Investors gain N35.72trn as reforms fuel stock market surge
Summary: Market capitalisation nearly N100trn in value •Foreign portfolio transactions up 178.8% YoY in 11months . Market capitalised almost N100 trillion in value . Market capitalisation narrowed Nigeria's share market value to N35.72trn .

Title: Full Speech: Tinubu promises to consolidate economic gains in 2026 New Year address
Summary: Tinubu said Nigeria ended 2025 on a strong footing, recording robust quarterly economic growth, improving trade balances and greater exchange rate stability . He promised to consolidate economic gains in 2026 New Year address .

Title: Naira ends 2025 higher at official market
Summary: The naira closed 2025 stronger against the US dollar at N1,435.75 at the official foreign exchange market . Central Bank of Nigeria data showed that the currency gained N9.93, marking continued firmness at the year end .

Title: Nigeria'll deepen global security cooperation in 2026 – Tinubu
Summary: President Bola Tinubu reaffirmed commitment to strengthening Nigeria’s security architecture in 2026 . He said the government would continue to adopt a comprehensive security approach that combines intelligence-led operations, international partnerships, and institutional reforms . Title: FULL SPEECH: Tinubu projects lower inflation, stronger growth in 2026 New Year address
Summary: President Bola Tinubu said 2026 would mark the beginning of a more robust phase of economic growth for Nigeria . He cited moderating inflation, improved foreign reserves, rising investment inflows and sustained GDP expansion as evidence that recent reforms are beginning to yield results . Title: Democrat Zohran Mamdani makes history as New York’s first Muslim mayor
Summary: Zohran Mamdani was sworn in as mayor of New York City just after midnight on Thursday . He took the oath of office at a decommissioned subway station beneath Manhattan . Summary: CAF have released the full fixtures for the Round of 16 at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025 following the conclusion of the group stage .
